title: CISA: New Submarine malware found on hacked Barracuda ESG appliances
description: CISA says new malware known as Submarine was used to backdoor Barracuda ESG (Email Security Gateway) appliances by exploiting a now-patched zero-day bug. [...]

title: Apple says new App Store API rules will limit user fingerprinting
description: Starting this fall, Apple has announced that developers will be required to provide a reason for using certain APIs that can collect information from their apps' users. [...]

title: The Week in Ransomware - July 28th 2023 - New extortion tactics
description: With ransom payments declining, ransomware gangs are evolving their extortion tactics to utilize new methods to pressure victims. [...]

title: Ivanti patches new zero-day exploited in Norwegian govt attacks
description: Ivanti has fixed another vulnerability in the Endpoint Manager Mobile software (formerly MobileIron Core), exploited as a zero-day to breach the IT systems of a dozen ministries in Norway. [...]

title: Twitter's rebranding to 'X' triggers Microsoft Edge security alert
description: Microsoft Edge web browser has been displaying security warnings after Twitter changed its name to 'X'. It's got to do with a security feature dubbed 'Progressive Web App Icon change', designed to keep users safe during app icon or name changes. [...]

title: CISA warns of breach risks from IDOR web app vulnerabilities
description: CISA warned today of the significant breach risks linked to insecure direct object reference (IDOR) vulnerabilities impacting web applications in a joint advisory with the Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) and U.S. National Security Agency (NSA). [...]

title: New Android malware uses OCR to steal credentials from images
description: Two new Android malware families named 'CherryBlos' and 'FakeTrade' were discovered on Google Play, aiming to steal cryptocurrency credentials and funds or conduct scams. [...]

title: Hawai'i Community College pays ransomware gang to prevent data leak
description: The Hawaiʻi Community College has admitted that it paid a ransom to ransomware actors to prevent the leaking of stolen data of approximately 28,000 people. [...]
